intro: Pentaphylax malayana, commonly known as the Malayan pentaphylax, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
